sect1.title: Class Constants
sect1.para: It is possible to define constants on a per-class basis remaining the same and unchangeable. The default visibility of class constants is public.

note.para: Class constants can be redefined by a child class. As of PHP 8.1.0, class constants cannot be redefined by a child class if it is defined as final.

sect1.para: It's also possible for interfaces to have constants. Look at the interface documentation for examples.
It's possible to reference the class using a variable. The variable's value can not be a keyword (e.g. self, parent and static).
Note that class constants are allocated once per class, and not for each class instance.

example.title: Defining and using a constant
example.programlisting:
<?php
class MyClass
{
    const CONSTANT = 'constant value';

    function showConstant() {
        echo  self::CONSTANT . "\n";
    }
}

echo MyClass::CONSTANT . "\n";

$classname = "MyClass";
echo $classname::CONSTANT . "\n";

$class = new MyClass();
$class->showConstant();

echo $class::CONSTANT."\n";
?>

example.title: Namespaced ::class example
example.programlisting:
<?php
namespace foo {
    class bar {
    }

    echo bar::class; // foo\bar
}
?>

example.title: Class constant expression example
example.programlisting:
<?php
const ONE = 1;
class foo {
    const TWO = ONE * 2;
    const THREE = ONE + self::TWO;
    const SENTENCE = 'The value of THREE is '.self::THREE;
}
?>

note.para: As of PHP 7.1.0 visibility modifiers are allowed for class constants.

note.simpara: As of PHP 8.3.0 visibility variance is checked more strictly. Prior to this version, the visibility of a class constant could be different from the visibility of the constant in the implemented interface.

example.title: Fetch class constant syntax, as of PHP 8.3.0
example.programlisting:
<?php
class Foo {
    public const BAR = 'bar';
    private const BAZ = 'baz';
}

$name = 'BAR';
echo Foo::{$name}, PHP_EOL; // bar
?>

note.para: As of PHP 8.3.0, class constants can be fetched dynamically using a variable.
